div.dateline:
Frere Lodge, Ashburton Road,
Croydon, England.
May 21, 1883
div.p: Yours of May 15 just to hand.

The Rev. Lorimer Fison, M. A., Lorimer Fison (1832-1907), britischer Anthropologe und „Wesleyan missionary to Fiji“; vgl.
Darell Whiteman, in: Gerald H. Anderson (Hrsg.), Biographical Dictionary of Christian Missions, Cambridge; MacMillan, New York, 1997, 213 ; vgl. HSA 05136 (Brief aus Navula/Fidji, 17.8.1883). formerly of the Cambridge University, now Intor Wohl eine Abk. für „Instructor“, Dozent. of our College in Fiji for training native agents, is pre-eminently the man who can give all possible information of language in the South Pacific.
His wife and family are near Melbourne, for health; and he will be likely to join them at the end of this year.
